faq.question: Do I need any prior singing experience?
faq.answer: Not at all! This foundation course is designed for complete beginners as well as those who want to build proper vocal technique. We start from the basics including posture, breathing exercises, and gradually progress to more advanced techniques.

faq.question: What if I miss a class?
faq.answer: Every live session is recorded in HD and shared privately with you. You'll also receive assignments and feedback through our system so you never fall behind. You can review vocal exercises and theory lessons anytime.

faq.question: What age group is this for?
faq.answer: We've trained students from age 7 to 75+! The course is structured to adapt to each learner's goals, vocal range, and pace. It's never too early or too late to start your vocal journey.

faq.question: Can I learn from outside India?
faq.answer: Yes! Our classes are time-zone friendly and available live online or in hybrid mode (live + recordings). We have students joining from all over the world, from Singapore to the U.S., learning at their convenience.

faq.question: Do I get a certificate after completing the course?
faq.answer: Yes. You'll receive a graded performance-based certificate from the Nathaniel School of Music after completing your semester. It reflects your progress in vocal technique, theory, rhythm, and performance.

faq.question: How much time should I practice every week?
faq.answer: We recommend at least 30 minutes a day or 3â€“4 hours a week to see steady progress. Each class includes vocal exercises, warm-ups, and technique drills that you can build upon at home.

faq.question: Can I continue learning after the Foundation Course?
faq.answer: Absolutely. You can move into our advanced vocal modules where you'll learn advanced techniques, repertoire building, improvisation, and professional performance skills.

faq.question: What styles of singing will I learn?
faq.answer: You'll explore various genres and vocal styles including pop, rock, blues, gospel, Bollywood, and classical techniques. We focus on developing versatility so you can sing across multiple styles confidently.

faq.question: Will I get to perform somewhere?
faq.answer: Yes! We organize jamming sessions and showcases where students get the chance to perform in front of others. We also feature student performances on our Instagram page. Performance experience is a key part of our curriculum.

faq.question: Do I get a demo session before enrolling?
faq.answer: We don't offer free demo sessions before enrollment. However, you can explore our teaching style and class structure from our YouTube channel or the free tutorials on our website. These will give you a good idea of what our classes are like and the kind of learning experience you can expect.

faq.question: What's the learning approach in the Vocal Foundation Course?
faq.answer: We focus on developing both technical skills and musical intelligence necessary to use your voice creatively and effectively. Like every instrumentalist, singers need proper education, practice, and constant care to develop their vocal potential. Our curriculum covers warm-up exercises, breath control, vocal dynamics, resonance, register transitions, articulation, and performance skills, all integrated with music theory, ear training, and rhythm practice.
